intro: Jurinella macrocephala, commonly known as the large-headed jurinella, is a flowering plant native to the United States, particularly in the southeastern region. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and violet. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils along streambanks and in woodland areas. Jurinella macrocephala is a perennial herb that produces capsule fruits containing numerous small, dry seeds.
